input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: InfobloxNIOS.

Creates and reserves a new IP range within an existing network.
Sample items Xml:
<items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network>10.10.10.0/24</network> <start-address>10.10.10.20</start-address> <end-address>10.10.10.30</end-address> <ipv6-start-prefix>2001:db8:0:c000:0011::</ipv6-start-prefix> <ipv6-end-prefix>2001:db8:0:c000:0021::</ipv6-end-prefix> <ipv6-prefix-bits>32</ipv6-prefix-bits> <template>Test template</template> <name>Test Range</name> <comment>user comment</comment> <disable>true</disable> <failover-association>Test Association</failover-association> <grid-member-address>10.0.0.1</grid-member-address> <recycle-leases>true</recycle-leases> <lease-settings> <lease-time>360</lease-time> <routers>10.0.0.1,10.0.0.2</routers> <domain-name>domain.com</domain-name> <broadcast-address>10.0.0.3</broadcast-address> <dns-servers>10.0.0.4,10.0.0.5</dns-servers> </lease-settings> <extensible-attributes> <attribute> <key>Building</key> <value>value1</value> </attribute> <attribute> <key>Site</key> <value>value2</value> </attribute> </extensible-attributes> </parameters> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
target[Conditional]: host[Conditional]: Host name or IP address of Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
user-name[Conditional]: Username required to connect Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
password[Conditional]: The password associated with the <user-name> provided. Encrypted password can be provided by providing an "encryption-type" attribute. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets. Valid values for encryption-type are: Plain, Base64 Default value: Plain
timeout-secs[Optional] Specifies the time, in seconds, after which the attempt to connect to the Infoblox Grid Manager Server fails. Default value in seconds: 60
Note: If no adapter configurations are specified while configuring the adapter dynamic target need to be defined under "target" tag.
network[Required] Specify the network in CIDR format.
start-address[Conditional] Specify the start address of the IP range. This parameter is required for IPv4 range.
end-address[Conditional] Specify the end address of the IP range. This parameter is required for IPv4 range.
ipv6-start-prefix[Optional] Specify the start prefix of the IPv6 range. This parameter is only valid for IPv6 range.
ipv6-end-prefix[Optional] Specify the end prefix of the IPv6 range. This parameter is only valid for IPv6 range.
ipv6-prefix-bits[Optional] Specify the prefix bits of the IPv6 range. This parameter is only valid for IPv6 range.
template[Optional] Specify the template to create the IP range.
name[Optional] Specify a name for the range.
disable[Optional] Disable the network after creation. This is a boolean parameter. Valid values - true, false
comment[Optional] Specify the user comment for the created range.
failover-association[Optional] Specify the failover association for the created range. This parameter is only applicable for IPv4 range. Note: Either one of "failover-association" or "grid-member-address" should be provided. If both are provided "failover-association" takes precedence.
grid-member-address[Optional] Specify the IP address of the grid member for the created range. Note: Either one of "failover-association" or "grid-member-address" should be provided. If both are provided "failover-association" takes precedence.
recycle-leases[Optional] If the flag is enabled, the leases are kept in recycle bin until one week after expiration. When the flag is disabled, the leases are irrecoverably deleted. This is a boolean parameter and is only applicable when grid-member-address is specified for this range. This parameter is only valid for IPv6 range. Valid values - true, false
extensible-attributes[Optional] Specifies additional custom attributes defined in Infoblox Grid Manager application. Sample format to define an attribute: <attribute> <key>Site</key> <value>value2</value> </attribute>
key[Optional] Specify the key for the attribute
value[Optional] Specify the value for the attribute
lease-settings[Optional] Specifies the optional lease setting options. These options are only valid for IPv4 range.
lease-time[Optional] Specify the lease time. This paramter is only valid if either one of "failover-association" or "grid-member-address" is provided. This option is only valid for IPv4 range.
routers[Optional] Specify the ip addresses of routers. Ip address should be seperated by comma. For example 10.0.0.1,10.0.0.2. This paramter is only valid if either one of "failover-association" or "grid-member-address" is provided. This option is only valid for IPv4 range.
domain-name[Optional] Specify the domain name. This paramter is only valid if either one of "failover-association" or "grid-member-address" is provided. This option is only valid for IPv4 range.
broadcast-address[Optional] Specify the broadcast address. This paramter is only valid if either one of "failover-association" or "grid-member-address" is provided. This option is only valid for IPv4 range.
dns-servers[Optional] Specify the dns servers. This paramter is only valid if either one of "failover-association" or "grid-member-address" is provided. This option is only valid for IPv4 range.
